Package com.intellij.ui.scale

Class UserScaleContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.ui.scale.UserScaleContext
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JBUI.BaseScaleContext

    public class UserScaleContext
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a snapshot of the user space scale factors: ScaleType.USR_SCALE and ScaleType.OBJ_SCALE). The context can be associated with a UI object (see ScaleContextAware) to define its HiDPI behaviour. Unlike ScaleContext, UserScaleContext is device scale independent and is thus used for vector-based painting.
    See Also:
    ScaleContextAware, ScaleContext

      • overrideScale

        public boolean overrideScale(Scale scale)
        Permanently overrides the provided scale (the scale won't be changed on subsequent update()). Can be used to make a UI object user scale independent:

        ((ScaleContextAware)uiObject).getScaleContext().overrideScale(USR_SCALE.of(1.0));
        Parameters:
        scale - the new scale to override
        Returns:
        whether the new scale updated the current value
        See Also:
        ScaleType.of(double)

      • isScaleOverridden

        protected boolean isScaleOverridden(Scale scale)

      • setScale

        public boolean setScale(Scale scale)
        Sets the new scale (system scale is ignored). Use ScaleType.of(double) to provide the new scale. Note, the new scale value can be change on subsequent update(). Use overrideScale(Scale) to set a scale permanently.
        Parameters:
        scale - the new scale to set
        Returns:
        whether the new scale updated the current value
        See Also:
        ScaleType.of(double)

      • getScale

        public double getScale(ScaleType type)
        Returns:
        the context scale factor of the provided type (1d for system scale)
